snippet: Five percent of the students offered placement in eight specialized high schools were black and 7 percent were Hispanic, according to statistics released on Thursday.
abstract: Education Dept statistics show that number of black and Hispanic students being admitted to New York City's elite public high schools has remained virtually unchanged in 2015, with 5 percent of 5,103 placements being offered to black students and 7 percent to Hispanics; legislators and educators disagree over how to fix problem.
lead_paragraph: Five percent of the students offered placement in eight specialized high schools were black and 7 percent were Hispanic, according to statistics released on Thursday.

headline.main: Lack of Diversity Persists in Admissions to New York City’s Elite High Schools
headline.print_headline: Lack of Diversity Persists in Admissions to Elite City Schools
